metadata.title: CVE-2015-0822 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Form Autocompletion feature in Mozilla Firefox before 36.0, Firefox ESR31.x before 31.5, and Thunderbird before 31.5 allows remote attackers toread arbitrary files via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0822` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-globalmenu - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-testsuite - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
